intro: For centuries, people have believed that sneezing has very important spiritual meanings. While there’s no scientific evidence to support these beliefs, they’re still fun to think about! In this article, we’ll tell you everything that sneezing means, including how many times you sneeze and what time of day you sneeze. Keep reading to learn more!

points.name: What is the spiritual meaning of sneezing?

steps.title: Sneezing repeatedly could mean that you’re in doubt of yourself.
steps.subtitle: If you seem to keep sneezing, it may be a sign that you lack self-esteem or feel powerless. You may feel like you’re having difficulty fully being yourself or out-of-touch with your inner child.
sub-points: Sneezing over and over might also be a sign that you’re feeling constantly irritated, aggressive, or impatient.

points.name: Sneezing at a Certain Time of Day

steps.title: Sneezing during the evening or afternoon represents the end of a cycle.
steps.subtitle: When you sneeze at the end of a long day, it may be a release of tension that you accumulate throughout the day. Here are other meanings, depending on the exact time you sneezed:
sub-points: 1-2 pm: Someone is thinking about you romantically.
2-3 pm: You may be about to experience rejection or enter an argument.
3-4 pm: Your greatest dream will soon come true.
4-5 pm: You can count on the ones you love most to help you.
5-6 pm: A loved one may be holding a grudge against you.
6-7 pm: You may encounter a few minor issues with money.
7-8 pm: Keep an eye out for unexpected changes in the near future.
8-9 pm: Your partner might give you a special gift.
9-10 pm: A meeting with someone you don’t know may surprise you.
10-11 pm: You’re going to encounter unexpected happiness.
11-12 pm: You may have been deceived by someone.

steps.title: Sneezing is a reflex that happens when nerve endings inside your nose are stimulated.
steps.subtitle: Sneezing is called “sternutation” and is an automatic reflex that is triggered when dust, perfume, smoke, mold, or other irritants enter the mucous membranes of your nose. Sneezing can also be caused by allergies, sickness, or a change in temperature, light, or air moisture. Throughout human history, people have associated both good and bad spiritual meanings with this normal reaction.
sub-points: Some people believe that the heart stops when you sneeze, but this is now considered a myth.
